Description: Brass lamp-handle of rod form, solid, curving forward to terminate in the head of a gryphon, with a ball in its beak. Just above the break of the rod a feature, now broken, emerged, probably a leaf. Surface colouration: dark green.
Curator's comments: Compare a gryphon-handle of a rather different type, from the Saalburg: 'Saalburg Jahrbuch' 6, 1914-1924, pl. VIII, 4.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3687)
Condition: incomplete - handle only. Surface coloration: dark green.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
